episodeTitle: Ace's Convoy Begins! Battle on the Lowest Floor - Level 6!
description: Luffy, Ivankov, and Inazuma reach Level 6 of Impel Down only to discover Ace has already been transferred. They meet Jinbe, Ace's former cellmate, who urges them to escape quickly. Hannyabal traps them with sleeping gas, but Inazuma uses his Choki Choki no Mi ability to save them. Meanwhile, Ace is handed over to Vice Admiral Onigumo for transport to Marineford. The episode ends with Luffy encountering his former enemy, Crocodile, who offers to help them escape.

events.title: Arrival at Level 6: Eternal Hell
events.description: Luffy, Emporio Ivankov, and Inazuma successfully reach Level 6 of Impel Down, known as Eternal Hell - the deepest and most heavily guarded level where the world's most dangerous criminals are imprisoned. This level houses prisoners so notorious that their very existence has been erased from history.
events.significance: Marks Luffy's arrival at the deepest level of Impel Down where Ace was being held, representing the culmination of his desperate descent through the prison levels. Level 6 contains some of the most powerful characters in the One Piece world.

quotes.text: This is it! Level 6! Ace should be here!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's excitement and hope upon reaching Level 6

events.title: Jinbe's First Full Appearance
events.description: Jinbe, the Fish-Man and former Warlord of the Sea, appears imprisoned in Level 6 where he was Ace's cellmate. He immediately recognizes Luffy by his straw hat and urgently informs him that prison staff extracted Ace from his cell only moments ago, and there's still a chance to catch up to him.
events.significance: This is Jinbe's first major speaking role and interaction with Luffy, establishing their relationship and Jinbe's connection to Ace. This moment begins Jinbe's journey toward eventually joining the Straw Hat crew.

quotes.text: You must be Ace's brother! I recognize that straw hat! They just took him away moments ago - you might still catch him!
quotes.speaker: Jinbe
quotes.context: Jinbe's urgent warning to Luffy about Ace's transfer

events.title: Jinbe and Ace's Cellmate Bond Revealed
events.description: Jinbe explains that he was Ace's cellmate in Level 6 and that Ace spent his time telling Jinbe stories about his younger brother Luffy. This revelation shows the deep respect Jinbe already has for Luffy through Ace's tales.
events.significance: Establishes the connection between Jinbe and Ace, and explains why Jinbe is so eager to help Luffy. This moment plants the seeds for Jinbe's eventual alliance with the Straw Hats and his understanding of Luffy's character.

quotes.text: Ace told me all about you. He was so proud of his little brother who was going to become the Pirate King.
quotes.speaker: Jinbe
quotes.context: Jinbe revealing his connection to Ace and knowledge of Luffy

events.title: Discovery of Ace's Empty Cell
events.description: The rescue party discovers that Ace's cell is empty - he has already been moved to the upper levels for transfer to Marine custody. This devastating revelation means they are too late to prevent Ace from being taken to his execution at Marineford.
events.significance: This is a major turning point in the arc. Luffy's rescue attempt has failed in its primary objective, forcing him to decide whether to escape and pursue Ace to Marineford or give up. This moment drives the remainder of the Impel Down arc and sets up the Marineford War.

quotes.text: He's... he's gone! Ace is gone!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's shock and despair upon discovering Ace's empty cell

events.title: Hannyabal's Level 6 Trap Activated
events.description: Hannyabal springs a carefully planned trap on the Level 6 infiltrators. He destroys the elevator system, blocks the stairwell access, and releases sleeping gas throughout Level 6 to capture Luffy, Ivankov, and Inazuma before they can escape.
events.significance: Demonstrates Hannyabal's competence as a jailer and creates a desperate situation for the rescue party. This trap forces them to rely on Inazuma's Devil Fruit abilities and consider desperate measures like releasing dangerous prisoners.

quotes.text: You fools! Did you think you could just waltz into Level 6 and leave? I've cut off all your escape routes!
quotes.speaker: Hannyabal
quotes.context: Hannyabal revealing his trap to the intruders

events.title: Inazuma's Choki Choki no Mi Ability Demonstrated
events.description: As sleeping gas floods Level 6, Inazuma reveals the full extent of his Choki Choki no Mi (Snip-Snip Fruit) powers. He transforms his hands into giant scissors and cuts the stone floor into strips, then folds them over the staircase to block the sleeping gas from reaching them, treating solid stone as if it were paper.
events.significance: This is the first major demonstration of Inazuma's unique Devil Fruit ability, showcasing the creative and versatile applications of the Choki Choki no Mi. This power proves crucial for the escape from Impel Down.

quotes.text: Inazuma ate the Choki Choki no Mi! He's a Scissors Human who can cut anything like paper!
quotes.speaker: Ivankov
quotes.context: Ivankov explaining Inazuma's Devil Fruit ability to Luffy

events.title: Ace's Rebellion Against Magellan
events.description: On Level 1, after learning that Luffy has been trapped on Level 6, Ace attempts to fight back against Magellan to return and help his brother. However, weakened by imprisonment and Seastone shackles, Ace is easily subdued by the Chief Warden's overwhelming poison abilities.
events.significance: Shows Ace's deep love for his brother and his willingness to sacrifice himself for Luffy. This failed attempt also demonstrates just how weakened Ace has become and foreshadows his inability to save himself at Marineford.

quotes.text: Luffy! I have to go back! I have to save my little brother!
quotes.speaker: Ace
quotes.context: Ace's desperate attempt to break free and return to Level 6

events.title: Ace Transferred to Vice Admiral Onigumo
events.description: After subduing Ace's rebellion, Magellan personally hands over Portgas D. Ace to Vice Admiral Onigumo and the Marine forces. This transfer marks the official handoff from Impel Down custody to the Navy, beginning Ace's final journey to the execution platform at Marineford.
events.significance: This is the point of no return for Ace's execution. Once in Marine custody, Ace is beyond Impel Down's jurisdiction and on an irreversible path to Marineford. This moment escalates the urgency for Luffy and sets the stage for the Summit War.

quotes.text: Vice Admiral Onigumo, Portgas D. Ace is now in your custody. Take him to Marineford for execution.
quotes.speaker: Magellan
quotes.context: Magellan officially transferring Ace to Navy custody

events.title: Luffy Encounters Crocodile in Level 6
events.description: As Luffy searches for a way to escape Level 6, he encounters his former enemy Crocodile, the ex-Warlord of the Sea whom he defeated in Alabasta. Crocodile, imprisoned after his defeat, offers to help Luffy and his companions escape if they free him from his cell.
events.significance: This shocking reunion between Luffy and Crocodile sets up an unlikely alliance between former enemies. Crocodile's offer represents a desperate gamble for both parties and introduces major complications for the escape plan.

quotes.text: Well, well... if it isn't Straw Hat. Fancy meeting you here in hell.
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Crocodile's sardonic greeting to Luffy in Level 6

events.title: Ivankov's Secret About Crocodile Revealed
events.description: When Ivankov suggests releasing Crocodile to help with the escape, he reveals that he knows a 'precious weakness' or secret about Crocodile from when Crocodile was still a rookie pirate. Ivankov uses this knowledge as leverage to ensure Crocodile's cooperation and prevent betrayal.
events.significance: This mysterious revelation about Crocodile's past becomes one of the series' enduring mysteries. It establishes a power dynamic that keeps Crocodile in check and hints at a deeper history between the Revolutionary Army and the former Warlord.

quotes.text: Don't worry, I can keep Crocodile under control. I know his precious weakness from his rookie days. If he tries anything, I'll reveal it to the world.
quotes.speaker: Ivankov
quotes.context: Ivankov's cryptic threat to ensure Crocodile's cooperation

events.title: Luffy Decides to Pursue Ace to Marineford
events.description: Despite learning that Ace has already been transferred out of Impel Down, Luffy makes the fateful decision to escape the prison and continue pursuing Ace to Marineford. Ivankov, moved by Luffy's determination and seeing similarities to Dragon, decides to fully support this desperate plan.
events.significance: This decision commits Luffy to the path that leads to the Marineford War. It shows Luffy's unwavering determination to save his brother regardless of the impossible odds, a character-defining moment that inspires those around him.

quotes.text: I don't care if I have to fight the whole Navy! I'm going to save Ace!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's declaration of intent to pursue Ace to Marineford

quotes.text: That determination... just like Dragon. Very well, Straw Boy, I'll help you!
quotes.speaker: Ivankov
quotes.context: Ivankov committing to help Luffy after seeing his resolve

events.title: Jinbe Requests to Join the Escape
events.description: After hearing Luffy's plan to pursue Ace to Marineford, Jinbe pleads to be released from his cell as well. He explains that he wants to save Ace just as badly as Luffy and is willing to die a 'glorious death' attempting to prevent the war and protect Whitebeard. Luffy agrees to free him.
events.significance: This marks the beginning of Jinbe's alliance with Luffy and eventual path to joining the Straw Hat Pirates. It shows Jinbe's loyalty to both Ace and Whitebeard, and his willingness to sacrifice everything for his convictions.

quotes.text: Please, let me out too! I want to save Ace and protect Whitebeard from this war! I'm prepared to die trying!
quotes.speaker: Jinbe
quotes.context: Jinbe's passionate plea to join the escape attempt

quotes.text: You must be Ace's brother! I recognize that straw hat! They just took him away moments ago - you might still catch him!
quotes.speaker: Jinbe
quotes.context: First words to Luffy upon meeting him

quotes.text: Inazuma ate the Choki Choki no Mi! He's a Scissors Human who can cut anything like paper!
quotes.speaker: Ivankov

quotes.text: I don't care if I have to fight the whole Navy! I'm going to save Ace!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Declaration to pursue Ace to Marineford

quotes.text: Don't worry, I can keep Crocodile under control. I know his precious weakness from his rookie days.
quotes.speaker: Ivankov
quotes.context: Leverage over Crocodile to ensure cooperation

themes.description: The episode powerfully explores the bond between Luffy and Ace, with Luffy willing to risk everything to save his brother, and Ace attempting to fight back despite his weakness when he learns Luffy is in danger.
themes.symbolism: The empty cell represents both failure and determination - Luffy arrives too late, but refuses to give up.

themes.description: Desperation creates strange bedfellows as Luffy must consider allying with his former enemy Crocodile, and Ivankov uses his knowledge of Crocodile's past to ensure cooperation.
themes.symbolism: Level 6 bringing together enemies shows how extreme circumstances can override past conflicts.

themes.description: Jinbe's loyalty to both Ace and Whitebeard drives him to join the escape despite the dangers, showcasing the Fish-Man's strong sense of honor and gratitude.
themes.symbolism: Jinbe's imprisonment represents his willingness to sacrifice everything for his principles.
culturalReferences: Japanese concept of 'giri' (duty/obligation) shown through Jinbe's loyalty

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy faces the devastating realization that he's too late to save Ace from Impel Down, but his determination only strengthens. He commits to the even more dangerous plan of pursuing Ace to Marineford.
keyActions: Decides to pursue Ace to Marineford
Agrees to release Jinbe and Crocodile
quotes: I don't care if I have to fight the whole Navy! I'm going to save Ace!

characterSpotlights.development: Jinbe is properly introduced as Ace's cellmate and friend. He immediately recognizes Luffy through Ace's stories and commits to helping save Ace and protect Whitebeard.
keyActions: Informs Luffy that Ace was just transferred
quotes: Please, let me out too! I want to save Ace and protect Whitebeard from this war!

characterSpotlights.development: Despite his weakened state, Ace tries to fight back when he learns Luffy is in danger, showing the depth of his love for his brother. His transfer to Onigumo marks the beginning of the end.
keyActions: Is transferred to Vice Admiral Onigumo
quotes: Luffy! I have to go back! I have to save my little brother!

characterSpotlights.development: Ivankov sees Luffy's determination and is reminded of Dragon. He takes charge of the escape plan and reveals his leverage over Crocodile.
keyActions: Supports Luffy's decision to pursue Ace
Reveals his secret knowledge about Crocodile
quotes: That determination... just like Dragon. Very well, Straw Boy, I'll help you!

characterSpotlights.development: Inazuma demonstrates the full versatility of his Choki Choki no Mi powers, saving the group from Hannyabal's sleeping gas trap.
keyActions: Uses scissors ability to cut stone floor
Blocks sleeping gas with folded floor strips

characterSpotlights.development: Crocodile returns to the story as a prisoner in Level 6, offering to help Luffy escape. His cooperation is ensured by Ivankov's mysterious leverage.
keyActions: Offers to help with the escape
Is blackmailed by Ivankov into cooperation
quotes: Well, well... if it isn't Straw Hat. Fancy meeting you here in hell.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends several scenes for pacing, including Ace's rebellion against Magellan and the tension in Level 6.
Additional reaction shots and internal monologue from Luffy about Ace's empty cell.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts manga Chapter 540, pages 2-15.
Episode 442 achieved a 12.0% TV rating in Japan, ranking 3rd for the week.
This episode marks one of the early appearances of Katsuhisa Hoki as Jinbe's voice actor, replacing the late Daisuke Gori who passed away in 2010.
The opening 'Kaze wo Sagashite' by Mari Yaguchi with Straw Hat contains spoilers for both the Impel Down and Marineford arcs, showing events that haven't happened yet.

sources.title: Kaze wo Sagashite - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The mystery of Ivankov's knowledge about Crocodile's 'weakness' remains one of the series' unsolved mysteries as of 2025.
